did.abstract: Publications contain applications, brochures, flyers, pamphlets, newsletters, reports, and miscellaneous published items from the University of Michigan’s Office of Financial Aid detailing the administration and disbursement of financial aid to students.

bioghist.p: See the finding aid for the University of Michigan Office of Financial Aid records group for the office’s history.

scopecontent.p: The Office of Financial Aid (OFA) Publications record group is divided into seven series: Application Forms and Instructions, 1973-1999; Brochures and Pamphlets, ca 1957-1999; Directions in Financial Aid, 1979/80-1984/85, 1990/91; Flyers and Information Sheets, 1986-1996 and undated; Miscellaneous, 1990-1997; Newsletters, 1971-2001; and Reports, 1977-1989. The researcher should note that there are complete print runs for none of the publications in the record group; holdings for each title consist of more or less scattered sets of issues within the date ranges given.

Application Forms and Instructions, 1973-1999 includes blank University of Michigan financial aid applications, worksheets, and FAFSAs (Free Application for Federal Student Aid forms), as well as instructions on how to fill out these forms.

Brochures and Pamphlets, ca 1957-1999 begins with a file containing OFA descriptions of their brochures and pamphlets circa 1994, but many titles are fairly self-explanatory. Required Reading contains information on procedures and next steps for students who have received a financial aid award package from the university.

scopecontent.p: Directions in Financial Aid, 1979/80-1984/85, 1990/91 is comprised of Directions in Financial Aid, the publication containing the OFA's most official and complete descriptions of the options, programs, and services available to students seeking help financing their University of Michigan educations.

Flyers and Information Sheets, 1986-1996 and undated contains information on the work-study program (including tips on finding and interviewing for work-study jobs), estimated student budgets and expenses for various academic years, overviews of the various types of loans available from government and private organizations, and other handouts for students. The material covers some of the same information content as items in the Brochures and Pamphlets series, albeit in different format.

The items in the Miscellaneous, 1990-1997 series consist mostly of packets of handouts distributed by the OFA to various university groups, including departmental liaisons and prospective students. Also contained in this series is the Student Employment Handbook for University Employers from 1991.

did.unittitle: Student Employment Handbook for University Employers, 1991

scopecontent.p: There are three categories of newsletters in the Newsletters, 1971-2001 series: staff newsletters, general student newsletters, and student employment newsletters. The first category includes both in-house newsletters for OFA staff (OFA Bulletin and OFA Busybody) and a more official newsletter designed to be distributed university-wide (Financial Aid Newsletter, or FAN). The general student newsletters (The University of Michigan Office of Financial Aid Newsletter and its successor, Office of Financial Aid Newsletter, contain all of the official information on financial aid options and deadlines, as well as OFA procedures, for students. Finally, the student employment newsletters (Occasional News, Sporadic News, Student Employment Newsletter, Work-Study Monthly, and Work Study Newsletter) all relate to work-study jobs or other aspects of student employment as it relates to financial aid.

scopecontent.p: The Reports, 1977-1989 series is comprised mainly of OFA reports to the Regents and other university officials regarding the characteristics of students receiving financial aid upon entering the university and their debt loads after graduation. There is also a report describing the computerized information system the office used in 1989.
